benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered: Valid Deletion: Success 204 when removing all tags and specific tags (with and without tagDef).
Header Handling: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy validated; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment exercised, including special characters.
Non-Existent Resource: 404 for unknown invoice item ID.
Input Validation: 400 for invalid invoiceItemId format, malformed/partial tagDef, and missing required header.
Query Parameters: tagDef present/absent, empty, extra query params tolerated, IDs not present on item handled.
Security/Abuse: 401 for invalid auth; XSS/injection attempts in headers returning 400/422.
Service Reliability: 503 when service unavailable; integration dependency unavailable with expected behavior.
Performance: High-concurrency scenario to check throughput and data integrity.
Edge Cases: Removing when no tags; very large tagDef list leading to 204 or 413 as per limits.
Response Semantics: 204 with empty body asserted.
gaps: DELETE Concurrency Semantics: No explicit scenario for race conditions on the same invoice item (simultaneous deletes for same tags) and ensuring consistent/idempotent outcomes.
Idempotency: No follow-up delete after successful deletion to verify repeated deletes remain safe and return consistent status (e.g., still 204 and no side effects).
Query Encoding (collectionFormat=multi): No test for multi-valued tagDef encoded as repeated query params (tagDef=uuid1&tagDef=uuid2) and URL-encoding behavior.
Authorization vs Authentication: No 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated user lacking permission/role to remove tags.
Server Error Handling: No explicit 500 Internal Server Error simulation (e.g., DB failure) and expected error payload shape.
Content Negotiation/Headers: No verification of response headers (e.g., Content-Type for error responses, absence of body and possibly Content-Type on 204, Produces application/json on errors).
tagDef Deduplication/Mixed Validity: No scenario for duplicate UUIDs in tagDef or mix of valid and invalid UUIDs and the expected outcome (fail all vs partial processing).
Soft Delete Behavior: No assertion on whether deletion is soft vs hard (e.g., audit visibility, recoverability) per guideline expectation.
recommendations: Add scenarios for concurrent deletes on the same invoice item to assert no race conditions and consistent outcomes (e.g., both requests end 204, resulting state correct).
Add an idempotency test: delete tags, then repeat the same delete request and verify status and state remain correct.
Include tests demonstrating collectionFormat=multi for tagDef: repeated parameters, URL-encoding, and order/duplicates handling.
Introduce a 403 Forbidden test for a user lacking tag-removal permission to distinguish from 401.
Simulate a 500 Internal Server Error (e.g., forced DB failure) and verify proper status code and error body contract.
Validate response headers: for 204 ensure empty body and appropriate headers; for errors ensure Content-Type: application/json and structured error payload.
Test tagDef with duplicates and mixed valid/invalid UUIDs; define expected behavior (reject with 400 or process valid entries only) and assert it.
If applicable, add a soft-delete/audit visibility check (e.g., audit log entries created, ability to trace deletion) or explicitly assert hard-delete behavior to satisfy guideline.
